discussion.author: mbauman
discussion.text: I think the name Tar.jl is just fine, but given the scope of the package you could potentially use Targit.jl or Gittar.jl.  Both lend themselves to some great logos ðŸŽ¯ ðŸŽ¸ and make it clear that it's not (and will never be) a full implementation.

discussion.author: StefanKarpinski
discussion.text: Hold off on merging this, please. I'm going to think a bit about the scope and defaults for this packageâ€”whether it will be limited to what it does now or support more in the future.

discussion.author: DilumAluthge
discussion.text:
FWIW I think Tar.jl is fine.

You could also do PosixTar.jl to emphasize the specification that you implement.

[noblock]

discussion.author: StefanKarpinski
discussion.text: I think I'm going to go with Tar but I want to clarify the scope in the README first and think a bit about defaults in consideration of future features which broaden the scope beyond git.

discussion.author: DilumAluthge
discussion.text:
> I think I'm going to go with Tar but I want to clarify the scope in the README first and think a bit about default in consideration of future features which broaden the scope beyond git.

Sounds good. I can merge this whenever you are ready, just let me know.
